summary: In this statement for the record, we wrote that from 2017 through Jan. 2021, federal agencies built about 450 miles of barriers along the U.S. Southwest border. To expedite construction, they waived federal environmental and other laws. The construction harmed some cultural and natural resources, e.g., by blasting at a tribal burial site and altering water flows. Before building, the agencies assessed some potential effects...
title: Southwest Border: Cultural and Natural Resource Impacts from Barrier Construction
